title.en: God’s Judgement on Eve and Adam

en: God speaks directly to the woman and the man about the consequences of their choices.
Life continues, but it is now marked by struggle, pain, and responsibility.

lines: To the woman He said,
“I will greatly increase your pains in childbearing;
with pain you will give birth to children.
Your desire will be for your husband,
and he will rule over you.”
To Adam He said,
“Because you listened to your wife
and ate from the tree
about which I commanded you,
‘You must not eat of it,’
cursed is the ground because of you;
through painful toil you will eat of it
all the days of your life.
It will produce thorns and thistles for you,
and you will eat the plants of the field.
By the sweat of your brow
you will eat your food
until you return to the ground,
since from it you were taken;
for dust you are
and to dust you will return.”
Adam named his wife Eve,
because she would become
the mother of all the living.

question.en: What do you notice about how God speaks about consequences and continued life in this passage?
